TopicTitle: Unable to launch with Realism/Remote Tech

Articles.Content:
Greetings, I play with Remote Tech in my normal game so I am familiar with it. I have set up a small rocket with a communications sat following https://github.com/KSP-RO/RealismOverhaul/wiki/First-RO-Rocket as a guide. I altered it a bit to add a DP-10 omni for launch purposes. The rocket has electrical, a probe core and active omni antenna. When I hit launch, I am unable to control the rocket at all. Remote Tech shows no connection. What am I missing?

Cheers!

Moving this question to General Add-on Affairs, the place for all your mod-related questions.

Welcome aboard, Cmdrdogsworth.
Did you get the RT.setting cfg for the Realism mod ?

Did you get the RT.setting cfg for the Realism mod ?

That might be it. I downloaded the complete package with CKAN and just removed/reinstalled Remote Tech. Where would I find this config specifically?

That might be it. I downloaded the complete package with CKAN and just removed/reinstalled Remote Tech. Where would I find this config specifically?

Try here http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98033-Realism-Overhaul-Discussion-Thread?p=1501832&viewfull=1#post1501832

EDIT- think this is the link to the file https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/80983870/RemoteTech_Settings.cfg

MeCripp, that one is outdated. The settings file is now linked in the Realism Overhaul OP.

The issue is that while the settings file is required for use of RemoteTech *with* RSS, RO cannot itself require the file because it does not require RemoteTech. Thus people must install the file manually, but they often miss the bit in the Realism Overhaul OP telling them to do os.
